text:
(dramatic music)
(audience cheering)

- [Narrator] An amazing
shot in the Bundesliga
might take your breath away,
(audience cheering)

but with Bundesliga Match
Facts powered by AWS,
fans can understand precise factors
in play like never before.

Bundesliga and AWS create Match
Facts, like expected goals,
speed alert, and shot speed

by first continuously
capturing two types of data.

One is positional data from
more than a dozen cameras,
tracking players 25 times per second.
The other is event data.
Numerically, this is

around 3.6 million positional
data points per match
and 1600 event data points.

Then by using machine
learning and analytics,
AWS takes these millions of data points

to surface meaningful
insights about matches.
The expected goal stat
or X-Goals assesses the probability

of scoring in real time, using
factors like distance, angle,

pressure, goalkeeper position,
player speed, and more.
In this example,

our striker is around 20
meters away from the net
and near to a number of players.
According to the X-Goals model trained
on more than 50,000 shots,

this shot would fail in
roughly 94% of attempts,
or have a success rate of only 6%.
(audience cheering)
Let's look at another example.

Here, our striker sends
one rocketing at the net.
It looks almost unstoppable, but is it?
Well, the shot speed stat reveals

that this one was traveling
at 121 kilometers per hour.

At speeds like that, any keeper
is going to be hard-pressed
to make the stop.

Match Facts like these are
incorporated in real time

into live broadcasts, and
displayed on the Bundesliga app,

so fans can get a deeper combined
TV and mobile experience.
Also, Bundesliga, with the help of AWS,
automatically identifies data stories
for its commentary live system
that commentators can pick from
and highlight during matches.

AWS capabilities like
serverless computing,

machine learning, and container
computation make it possible
for Bundesliga Match Facts
to take data straight from the field
into the hands of the fans.

With groundbreaking data-driven
Bundesliga Match Facts,

AWS and Bundesliga are
bringing fans closer
to the game than ever before.
